page.title: 06FARMING IN BROMPTON
page.content: Around Brompton the most common type of farming is mixed.The soils vary from heavy to loam.They support strong healthy crops and grassland.The main crops in this area include barley, wheat,oats and potatoes.Some of these are grown for human consumption and some are to feed animals.In recent years the growing of oil-seed rape has become popular. The grassland is used for grazing or for winter feed(mostly silage with some hay).The type of animals found include cows(Friesians),beef cattle(Friesians & Charolais),sheep(Swaledale & Suffolks),pigs(Landrace & Large Whites) & some poultry.Milk is collected daily & taken to the dairy in Northallerton.Fat stock is sold in local auction marts e.g Northallerton & Darlington.Most farms are privately owned(50 to 250acres in size).
